overview:
Doug Wheeler is co-founder and Chief Operating Officer of Personal (www.personal.com), a digital life management platform that gives individuals the tools to build a private, personal network centered on a data vault where they can control access to their personal information and manage their online identity.

Doug manages Personalâ€™s operations, finance, strategy, and business development. He has 16 years of experience in managing global new media and tech companies.

Before Personal, Doug was COO and a member of the founding management team at The Map Network, one of the first online mapping companies. When the company was acquired by mapping giant NAVTEQ in 2006 and then Nokia in 2008, Doug served as Director of Product Management, Location Content Sources and Services.

In 1994, Doug helped to found New World Publishing, which owned and operated three English language print and online business journals in Central Europe, including the Warsaw Business Journal, the Budapest Business Journal, and the Prague Business Journal, where he also served as Publisher from 1996 to 2000.

Doug graduated cum laude with a B.A. from Claremont McKenna College and received his M.B.A. with Honors from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.
